an10.170:1.1: “Mendicants, I will teach you the near shore and the far shore.
an10.170:1.2: Listen and pay close attention, I will speak. …
an10.170:1.3: And what, mendicants, is the near shore? What is the far shore?
an10.170:1.4: Killing living creatures is the near shore, mendicants, and not killing living creatures is the far shore.
an10.170:1.5: Stealing is the near shore, and not stealing is the far shore.
an10.170:1.6: Sexual misconduct is the near shore, and avoiding sexual misconduct is the far shore.
an10.170:1.7: Lying is the near shore, and not lying is the far shore.
an10.170:1.8: Divisive speech is the near shore, and avoiding divisive speech is the far shore.
an10.170:1.9: Harsh speech is the near shore, and avoiding harsh speech is the far shore.
an10.170:1.10: Talking nonsense is the near shore, and avoiding talking nonsense is the far shore.
an10.170:1.11: Covetousness is the near shore, and contentment is the far shore.
an10.170:1.12: Ill will is the near shore, and good will is the far shore.
an10.170:1.13: Wrong view is the near shore, and right view is the far shore.
an10.170:1.14: This is the near shore, and this is the far shore.
an10.170:2.2: who cross to the far shore.
an10.170:3.1: When the teaching is well explained,
an10.170:3.3: are the ones who will cross over
an10.170:3.4: Death’s domain so hard to pass.
an10.170:4.2: an astute person should develop the bright.
an10.170:4.4: for the seclusion so hard to enjoy,
an10.170:5.1: you should try to find delight there,
an10.170:5.3: With no possessions, an astute person
an10.170:5.4: should cleanse themselves of mental corruptions.
an10.170:6.1: And those whose minds are rightly developed
an10.170:6.6: they are extinguished in this world.”
